intro: Arenaria ferganica, commonly known as Fergana sandflower, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers during the summer months. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Its ability to withstand harsh climatic conditions makes it an important species in ecological restoration projects.
